param.name: src1
param.desc: The first string to be compared.

param.name: src2
param.desc: The second string to be compared.

Documentation.firstline: Compares the two strings case insensitively
Documentation.content: Compares the two strings case insensitively. Returns a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer according to whether the first string is less than, equal to, or greater than the second.

param.name: src1
param.desc: The first string to be compared.

param.name: src2
param.desc: The second string to be compared.

Documentation.firstline: Tests whether the two strings are identical ignoring differences in case
Documentation.content: Tests whether the two strings are identical ignoring differences in case.

Definition.name: Find

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is searched

param.name: sought
param.desc: The string being sought.

param.name: instance
param.desc: Which match instance are we interested in?

Documentation.firstline: Returns the character position of the nth match of the search string with the first string
Documentation.content: Returns the character position of the nth match of the search string with the first string. If no match is found the attribute returns 0. If an instance is omitted the position of the first instance is returned.

Definition.Signature: UNSIGNED4 Find(STRING src, STRING sought, UNSIGNED4 instance = 1)

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is searched

param.name: sought
param.desc: The string being sought.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the number of occurences of the second string within the first string
Documentation.content: Returns the number of occurences of the second string within the first string.

Definition.name: WildMatch

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: pattern
param.desc: The pattern to match against.

param.name: ignore_case
param.desc: Whether to ignore differences in case between characters

Documentation.firstline: Tests if the search string matches the pattern
Documentation.content: Tests if the search string matches the pattern. The pattern can contain wildcards '?' (single character) and '*' (multiple character).

Definition.Signature: BOOLEAN WildMatch(STRING src, STRING _pattern, BOOLEAN ignore_case)

Definition.name: Contains

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: pattern
param.desc: The pattern to match against.

param.name: ignore_case
param.desc: Whether to ignore differences in case between characters

Documentation.firstline: Tests if the search string contains each of the characters in the pattern
Documentation.content: Tests if the search string contains each of the characters in the pattern. If the pattern contains duplicate characters those characters will match once for each occurence in the pattern.

Definition.Signature: BOOLEAN Contains(STRING src, STRING _pattern, BOOLEAN ignore_case)

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: filter
param.desc: The string containing the set of characters to be excluded.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the first string with all characters within the second string removed
Documentation.content: Returns the first string with all characters within the second string removed.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: filter
param.desc: The string containing the set of characters to be included.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the first string with all characters not within the second string removed
Documentation.content: Returns the first string with all characters not within the second string removed.

Definition.name: SubstituteIncluded

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: filter
param.desc: The string containing the set of characters to be included.

param.name: replace_char
param.desc: The character to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters included in the filter string
Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters included in the filter string. MORE: Should this be a general string substitution?

Definition.Signature: STRING SubstituteIncluded(STRING src, STRING filter, STRING1 replace_char)

Definition.name: SubstituteExcluded

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: filter
param.desc: The string containing the set of characters to be included.

param.name: replace_char
param.desc: The character to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters not included in the filter string
Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement character substituted for all characters not included in the filter string. MORE: Should this be a general string substitution?

Definition.Signature: STRING SubstituteExcluded(STRING src, STRING filter, STRING1 replace_char)

Definition.name: Translate

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: search
param.desc: The string containing the set of characters to be included.

param.name: replacement
param.desc: The string containing the characters to act as replacements.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the source string with the all characters that match characters in the search string replaced with the character at the corresponding position in the replacement string
Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the all characters that match characters in the search string replaced with the character at the corresponding position in the replacement string.

Definition.Signature: STRING Translate(STRING src, STRING search, STRING replacement)

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being converted.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the argument string with all upper case characters converted to lower case
Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with all upper case characters converted to lower case.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being converted.

Documentation.firstline: Return the argument string with all lower case characters converted to upper case
Documentation.content: Return the argument string with all lower case characters converted to upper case.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being converted.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the argument string with the first letter of each word in upper case and all other letters left as-is
Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with the first letter of each word in upper case and all other letters left as-is. A contiguous sequence of alphanumeric characters is treated as a word.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being converted.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the argument string with the first letter of each word in upper case and all other letters lower case
Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with the first letter of each word in upper case and all other letters lower case. A contiguous sequence of alphanumeric characters is treated as a word.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being reversed.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the argument string with all characters in reverse order
Documentation.content: Returns the argument string with all characters in reverse order. Note the argument is not TRIMMED before it is reversed.

Definition.name: FindReplace

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being transformed.

param.name: sought
param.desc: The string to be replaced.

param.name: replacement
param.desc: The string to be substituted into the result.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the source string with the replacement string substituted for all instances of the search string
Documentation.content: Returns the source string with the replacement string substituted for all instances of the search string.

Definition.Signature: STRING FindReplace(STRING src, STRING sought, STRING replacement)

param.name: src
param.desc: The string containing the comma separated list.

param.name: instance
param.desc: Which item to select from the list.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the nth element from a comma separated string
Documentation.content: Returns the nth element from a comma separated string.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string to be cleaned.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the source string with all instances of multiple adjacent space characters (2 or more spaces together) reduced to a single space character
Documentation.content: Returns the source string with all instances of multiple adjacent space characters (2 or more spaces together) reduced to a single space character. Leading and trailing spaces are removed, and tab characters are converted to spaces.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string being searched in.

param.name: prefix
param.desc: The prefix to search for.

Documentation.firstline: Returns true if the prefix string matches the leading characters in the source string
Documentation.content: Returns true if the prefix string matches the leading characters in the source string. Trailing spaces are stripped from the prefix before matching. // x.myString.StartsWith('x') as an alternative syntax would be even better

param.name: src
param.desc: The string being searched in.

param.name: suffix
param.desc: The prefix to search for.

Documentation.firstline: Returns true if the suffix string matches the trailing characters in the source string
Documentation.content: Returns true if the suffix string matches the trailing characters in the source string. Trailing spaces are stripped from both strings before matching.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string being searched in.

param.name: suffix
param.desc: The prefix to search for.

Documentation.firstline: Removes the suffix from the search string, if present, and returns the result
Documentation.content: Removes the suffix from the search string, if present, and returns the result. Trailing spaces are stripped from both strings before matching.

param.name: src
param.desc: The string containing the comma separated list.

param.name: mask
param.desc: A bitmask of which elements should be included. Bit 0 is item1, bit1 item 2 etc.

Documentation.firstline: Returns a string containing a list of elements from a comma separated string
Documentation.content: Returns a string containing a list of elements from a comma separated string.

Definition.name: CountWords

param.name: src
param.desc: The string being searched in.

param.name: separator
param.desc: The string used to separate words

param.name: allow_blank
param.desc: Indicates if empty/blank string items are included in the results.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the number of words that the string contains
Documentation.content: Returns the number of words that the string contains. Words are separated by one or more separator strings. No spaces are stripped from either string before matching.

Signature.name: CountWords
Signature.param: (STRING src, STRING separator, BOOLEAN allow_blank = FALSE)

Definition.Signature: UNSIGNED4 CountWords(STRING src, STRING separator, BOOLEAN allow_blank = FALSE)

Definition.name: SplitWords

param.name: src
param.desc: The string being searched in.

param.name: separator
param.desc: The string used to separate words

param.name: allow_blank
param.desc: Indicates if empty/blank string items are included in the results.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the list of words extracted from the string
Documentation.content: Returns the list of words extracted from the string. Words are separated by one or more separator strings. No spaces are stripped from either string before matching.

Signature.name: SplitWords
Signature.param: (STRING src, STRING separator, BOOLEAN allow_blank = FALSE)

Definition.Signature: SET OF STRING SplitWords(STRING src, STRING separator, BOOLEAN allow_blank = FALSE)

Definition.name: CombineWords

param.name: words
param.desc: The set of strings to be combined.

param.name: separator
param.desc: The string used to separate words.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the list of words extracted from the string
Documentation.content: Returns the list of words extracted from the string. Words are separated by one or more separator strings. No spaces are stripped from either string before matching.

Definition.Signature: STRING CombineWords(SET OF STRING words, STRING separator)

param.name: _left
param.desc: The first string to be compared.

param.name: _right
param.desc: The second string to be compared.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the minimum edit distance between the two strings
Documentation.content: Returns the minimum edit distance between the two strings. An insert change or delete counts as a single edit. The two strings are trimmed before comparing.
Documentation.return: The minimum edit distance between the two strings.

param.name: _left
param.desc: The first string to be compared.

param.name: _right
param.desc: The second string to be compared.

param.name: radius
param.desc: The maximum edit distance that is accepable.

Documentation.firstline: Returns true if the minimum edit distance between the two strings is with a specific range
Documentation.content: Returns true if the minimum edit distance between the two strings is with a specific range. The two strings are trimmed before comparing.
Documentation.return: Whether or not the two strings are within the given specified edit distance.

param.name: text
param.desc: The string to be broken into words.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the number of words in the string
Documentation.content: Returns the number of words in the string. Words are separated by one or more spaces.
Documentation.return: The number of words in the string.

param.name: text
param.desc: The string to be broken into words.

param.name: n
param.desc: Which word should be returned from the function.

Documentation.firstline: Returns the n-th word from the string
Documentation.content: Returns the n-th word from the string. Words are separated by one or more spaces.
Documentation.return: The number of words in the string.

param.name: text
param.desc: The string to be broken into words.

Documentation.firstline: Returns everything except the first word from the string
Documentation.content: Returns everything except the first word from the string. Words are separated by one or more whitespace characters. Whitespace before and after the first word is also removed.
Documentation.return: The string excluding the first word.

param.name: text
param.desc: The string to be broken into words.

Documentation.firstline: Returns everything except the last word from the string
Documentation.content: Returns everything except the last word from the string. Words are separated by one or more whitespace characters. Whitespace after a word is removed with the word and leading whitespace is removed with the first word.
Documentation.return: The string excluding the last word.

param.name: text
param.desc: The string to be broken into words.

param.name: n
param.desc: Which word should be returned from the function.

Documentation.firstline: Returns everything except the nth word from the string
Documentation.content: Returns everything except the nth word from the string. Words are separated by one or more whitespace characters. Whitespace after a word is removed with the word and leading whitespace is removed with the first word.
Documentation.return: The string excluding the nth word.

Definition.name: FindWord

param.name: src
param.desc: The string that is being tested.

param.name: word
param.desc: The word to be searched for.

param.name: ignore_case
param.desc: Whether to ignore differences in case between characters.

Documentation.firstline: Tests if the search string contains the supplied word as a whole word
Documentation.content: Tests if the search string contains the supplied word as a whole word.

Definition.Signature: BOOLEAN FindWord(STRING src, STRING word, BOOLEAN ignore_case=FALSE)
